Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Jeff Piwek, Trish Burley
Drug Comments: This bear had been free range darted by COS before Clayton arrived. The 450 mg Zoletil recorded above was the 0.9 vial top up that Clayton gave this bear to keep it asleep so it could be moved into a culvert.
Site Comments: Her mum (Melissa, EVGF73) was caught here in a culvert and collared, and her sibling (EVGF111) was free range darted and ear tagged.
Bear Comments: HWCR20-22694. One of Melissa’s 2 female COYs. Due to time constraints, no body measurements were taken. All three bears were translocated to the top of the Alexander drainage, NE of Podrasky cabin.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Jeff Piwek, Trish Burley
Drug Comments: This bear had been free range darted by COS before Clayton arrived. The 450 mg Zoletil recorded above was the 0.9 vial top up that Clayton gave this bear to keep it asleep so it could be moved into a culvert.
Site Comments: Her mum (Melissa, EVGF73) was caught here in a culvert and collared, and her sibling (EVGF112) was free range darted and ear tagged.
Bear Comments: HWCR20-22694. One of Melissa’s 2 female COYs. Due to time constraints, no body measurements were taken. All three bears were translocated to the top of the Alexander drainage, NE of Podrasky cabin.

Bear Photo: IMG_8610.jpg; IMG_5913.jpeg; IMG_5963.jpeg; IMG_8603.jpg; IMG_8602.jpg; IMG_5948.jpeg; IMG_5949.jpeg
Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Jeff Piwek, Trish Burley
Drug Comments: We used 2 vials of Zoletil on Melissa.
Site Comments: Melissa had 2 COYs (both female) with her. Melissa was caught in the culvert overnight, then her COYs were free ranged in the morning by COS.
Trap Wound Comments: Minimal - one broken (and bloody) front claw. Most of her other claws were partially broken and worn down, but weren’t bloody.
Rot off comments: Vectronic 4 layer (2 x 3 ply, but cut 2 layers in half). Collar programmed to blow off in just over a year. Drop off ID is 13871.
Teeth Photos: IMG_8610.jpg; IMG_5913.jpeg; IMG_5963.jpeg; IMG_8603.jpg; IMG_8602.jpg; IMG_5948.jpeg; IMG_5949.jpeg; IMG_5951.jpeg; IMG_5952.jpeg
Bear Comments: HWCR20-22694. Melissa had been breaking into the chicken coop and grain shed, and she had been bugging horses. A male with 3 legs was shot at (and we think not actually hit, or at least not killed) at this property the same morning that Melissa was caught in the culvert. We did not weigh her, take body measurements, or measure fat due to time constraints. Melissa looked very healthy and sufficiently fat (she had a similar feel to a 25-30% fat bear). This bear was relocated, with her two female COYs, to the top of Alexander drainage, NE of Podrasky cabin.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Drug Comments: First dart (2.2 ml XZT) hit front right shoulder at 8:27 am. Second dart (1.2 ml XZT) hit back of front left arm at 8:35 am. Topped up by hand with 0.6 ml XZT at 9:00 am because he wasn’t fully down.
Site Comments: Caught in Clayton’s snare, Laura’s snare was still set.
Trap Wound Comments: Caught on his front left foot. Good catch, a little bit high, but no damage to the skin. He ripped off the outside claw on his snared foot. He had cracked his bottom left nub of a canine.
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer with waterproof treatment. Pre-programmed to blow off in 2 years.
Bear Comments: His temperature stayed steady at 38.5 degrees C. His teeth are terrible (almost no incisors, and all canines are broken and worn down). Left ear has two tears in it, so he might have once had an ear tag.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Drug Comments: First dart (3.2 ml XZT) hit on left side high on shoulder / neck at 3:52 pm. He was still head up after 10 minutes, so we topped up by hand with 0.8 ml XZT, then another 1 ml XZT.
Site Comments: Caught in Clayton’s snare, and Laura’s snare had been sprung. He was in the snare for a long time, but was very calm in the snare and had done almost no damage to the site. He didn’t trigger any photos.
Trap Wound Comments: He had chewed the pad of his left foot (the snared foot). It was an open wound, but it wasn’t bleeding. We wrapped it in a clean cloth and attached it with medical tape. This is the same foot he was caught on in May 2018 when he chewed off three of his toes.
Other Wound Comments: He had a small puncture wound with purulent discharge on the top of his head, and an old scar on his nose. He is missing three toes on his front left foot because he chewed them off when he was snared in May 2018.
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer with waterproof treatment. Pre-programmed to blow off in 2 years.
Bear Comments: We didn’t take many measurements because he had been in the snare for longer than we like and we wanted to expedite the process and get him reversed as soon as possible. Couldn’t get him totally away from the tree when weighing him, but we think 260 kg is close. He only ever had 1 ear tag, and he kept it for two years, so we decided to leave him with only one ear tag.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Ryan Gordon
Drug Comments: First dart (2.2 ml XZT) hit at 9:55 am, back on the rump. Bear was still up on all fours after 10 minutes (dart might have hit a bunch of fat). Hand injected (1.8 ml) at 10:20 am. Went down well. Reversed at 11:25 am.
Site Comments: Caught in Laura’s snare, and Clayton’s snare was sprung. One of her offspring (we think a 2YO) was loose and fierce (bluff charged Clayton and Ryan after they had darted Esme). She completely wrecked the site and chewed 4 large trees (none fell over).
Trap Wound Comments: She was caught well on her front right foot. Once the snare was loosened off, she started bleeding from a small puncture created by the lock on the snare. We put pressure on it with a cloth and taped the cloth on (and left it there when we reversed her).
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer with waterproof treatment. Pre-programmed to blow off in 2 years.
Bear Comments: Her neck skin was a bit loose, as if she were once fatter.

Surveyors: Laura Smit, Clayton Lamb
Drug Comments: First dart 1.0 ml XZT hit in neck at 7:42 am. Bear down hard in 1 minute. Reversed at 8:50 am, but he was already coming out of the drug a bit.
Site Comments: Caught in Laura’s snare. Mom (Kathy, EVGF66) was caught in Clayton’s snare.
Bear Comments: Did not take a tooth because he was waking up. Did not take measurements because we had two bears waiting for us at Michel Fish Hole site.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Drug Comments: First dart 2.2 ml XZT hit at 7:44 am. Bear was down in about 5 minutes. Reversed at 8:50 am.
Site Comments: Caught in Clayton’s snare. Her yearling (EVGM108) was caught in Laura’s snare.
Trap Wound Comments: Caught on front right foot. Good catch, no broken skin.
Other Wound Comments: She is missing all of her toes on her right foot from an old injury (it has been completely healed for several years).
Rot off comments: Vectronic 5 layer (2 x 3 ply, with 1 layer cut). Pre-programmed to blow off in 2.25 years. Drop off ID is 15507.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Drug Comments: First dart (375 mg Zoletil, mixed as XZT) hit high on left rump at 8:18 am. Bear pulled it out quickly. She was wide awake after 20 minutes, so hit her with a second dart (1.7 ml XZT = 350 mg Zoletil) high on right shoulder at 8:39 am. Bear was down in about 5 minutes. Topped up by hand with 1.6 ml XZT (300 mg Zoletil) because she was quickly coming out of the drug. Reversed with 2.6 ml atipamezole. She was up and gone within 2.5 hours.
Site Comments: Bear caught in Clayton’s snare. Laura’s snare was still set. The bear was pretty wild in the snare and had chewed down some small trees. She broke the pan off the trap.
Trap Wound Comments: She was caught on her front left foot. Good catch, no broken skin. Her gums were a bit bloody because she had chewed so much wood, and she had a small puncture would on the back of her head (likely from when she was thrashing around in the snare), but otherwise she was in good shape.
Rot off comments: Vectronic 6 layer (2 x 3 ply), pre-programmed to blow off in 4 years, and were comfortable with that timing. Drop off ID is 15504.
Bear Comments: We think she’s an adult female who hasn’t had cubs yet. We put her collar on quite tight (we tried it a half hole looser, but she would have been able to get it over her head). She won’t likely get much fatter this year, and she has lots of fur on her neck (that will wear off), so after lots of thought we were happy with her collar tightness.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Drug Comments: First dart (500 mg Zoletil, mixed with 1.3 ml X as XZT) hit high on his right chest at 8:37 am. Bear was still head up after 15 minutes. Second dart (500 mg Zoletil, mixed with 1.3 ml X as XZT) hit his rump at 9:00 am. Bear well down well in about 5 minutes.
Site Comments: Chandler was caught in Clayton’s snare, Laura’s snare was not sprung. He was very easy on the site and hardly tore it up.
Trap Wound Comments: Caught on front right foot. No broken skin. Very minor rubbing. Good catch.
Rot off comments: Vectronic 4 layer, pre-programmed to blow off in 2.25 years, and we are comfortable with that. Drop off ID is 15505.
Bear Comments: Bear was VERY calm in the snare (he was laying down when we arrived and only stood up when Clayton walked in to dart him), so we were sure we had caught him before. He weighs much less than when we caught him in Sept 2018 (he was 268 kg then, and we couldn’t even get him off the ground). He has lots of loose flesh around his neck, like a deflated balloon. We fit the collar in a half hole - just tight enough that he won’t be able to get it over his head. We don’t anticipate that he will ever be bigger than he is currently.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Drug Comments: First dart missed (but dart didn’t depress, so we still have the drug), second dart (500 mg Zoletil, mixed as XZT) hit at 8:53 am. Bear went down quickly. Couldn’t find the second dart, but we felt up his shoulder and it seemed like the needle was not in the bear.
Site Comments: Caught in Clayton’s snare, Laura’s snare not sprung.
Trap Wound Comments: Caught on front right foot. Wrist looked great. No broken skin, minimal rubbing.
Rot off comments: 2 layer Vectronic, pre-programmed to blow off in 1.25 years, and we’re happy with that. Drop off ID is 13870.
Bear Comments: Seems to be more wear on his teeth than we would have expected for his weight.

Surveyors: Garth Mowat, Clay Wilson, Bruce McLellan
Drug Comments: On September 1 (when they first tried to get Rachel), it was super windy and Garth missed her three times (twice with 3 vial darts and once with a 2 vial dart). On September 5 (when they tried again to get Rachel), the first dart (2.8 vials Zoletil) hit, and they topped her up by hand on the ground with 0.5 vials. Induction time = 20 minutes.
Rot off comments: Vectronic 6 layer (3 x 2 layer). Programmed to blow off in 208 weeks (almost 4 years), and we’re comfortable with that timeline. Blow off ID is 15503.
Bear Comments: Removed Followit collar 6484 and replaced it with Vectronic collar 42580. The rot off on her old collar was almost ripped half way through on the side closest to her head, so it seem likely that it would have rotted off. No photos because the iPad battery died and Garth recorded everything by hand.

Surveyors: Garth Mowat, Bruce McLellan, Clay Wilson
Location comments: North end of the Fording Mine.
Drug Comments: First dart (3 vials of Zoletil in a 6 cc dart) hit.
Site Comments: Two big buffaloberry scats.
Other Wound Comments: Bruce said his old collar was a bit tight and had rubbed his neck. There was a little infection, but not so much that they were uncomfortable putting a new collar on him.
Rot off comments: Vectronic 3 layer, cut in almost 1 cm on each side. Pre-programmed to blow off in 117 weeks (2.25 years), but we want it off by next fall or end of spring 2022. Drop off ID is 15506.
Bear Comments: Removed Followit collar 6641 and replaced it with Vectronic collar 42577. They fit his new collar so it was just tight enough that he wouldn’t be able to flip it off. He seemed like much more than 13% fat (so maybe the fatometer was not working properly). His temperature was 40.3 C.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Drug Comments: First dart (2 ml) hit front right shoulder. She went down well, but had a twitch in her back left leg.
Site Comments: Captured on her back (left) foot. We’ve never had a back foot capture before, but she had been caught before and was likely stepping over the traps with her front feet.
Rot off comments: Laura 6 layer (3 x 2 layer) with waterproof treatment. Programmed to blow off in 3 years.
Bear Comments: We didn’t want to catch her again (first caught her September 14). We used all of the measurements from her original capture and we did fat this time because she was dry.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Drug Comments: First dart (2 ml) hit her in the back inner thigh. She went down well.
Site Comments: Caught in Clayton’s snare. Laura’s snare sprung, but caught up on the black thing!
Rot off comments: Laura 4 layer with waterproof treatment (not cut). Programmed to blow off in 3 years, but we want it off by the summer of 2022.
Bear Comments: Temperature was good (37.7). Collar was sized to 58 cm (should allow a fair bit of growth over the next few years). Took a lower premolar.
Comment: Marilyn died from natural causes on the east side of Erickson Ridge.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Jeff Piwek
Drug Comments: Jab stick with 0.5 ml. He went down well. Started to wake up (up on all fours) before we were done with Polly, so we didn’t reverse him. Had to get rid of about 0.3 of a vial of Zoletil because it was mixed with water in the jab stick and we didn’t need it all but we were not certain of the concentration of drug remaining in the jab stick.
Site Comments: His mum (Polly, EVGF102) was caught in the other snare and his sibling (another COY) was running free.
Trap Wound Comments: Loose top right incisor.
Bear Comments: He was waking up so we only tagged one ear.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Jeff Piwek
Drug Comments: First dart hit (2.2 ml). She ripped the dart out quickly, but the drug went in and she went down well.
Site Comments: 2 x COY (EVGM103 was caught in the other snare, and 1 x COY was running free).
Other Wound Comments: Her spine seemed a bit wonky, with a hard elevated bump about two thirds of the way down, but she seemed to move fine.
Rot off comments: Laura 4 layer with waterproof treatment. Programmed to blow off in 3 years.
Bear Comments: She looked a bit haggard; she was thin (could really feel her spine, so we aren’t confident in the fat measure below) and covered in burrs. Broke both of the top premolars when trying to extract and she didn’t have any bottom premolars.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Location comments: Caught at Fording River Operations mine site (location above), then moved in the back of the truck to the bottom of the Dry Creek Road and released there.
Drug Comments: Missed first dart (2.2 ml). Hit second dart (2.2 ml). Topped up by hand (1 ml). Before moving gave 1.3 ml by hand.
Site Comments: This lighter coloured bear was caught in Clayton’s snare and his darker coloured brother (EVGM100, Arthur) was caught in Laura’s snare. This bear was in the snare before we had finished baiting the site!
Rot off comments: Vectronic 2 layer (not cut). Programmed to blow off in 117 weeks (2.25 years), but we want it off by the summer of 2021. Drop off ID is 13870.
Bear Comments: Bear looked to be in great shape. Nice teeth, good and fat. Didn’t do fat because we were pressed for time. These siblings have been around the mine for months and didn’t seem to have any fear of humans.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Location comments: Caught at Fording River Operations mine site (location above), then moved in the back of the truck to the bottom of the Dry Creek Road and released there.
Drug Comments: First dart hit (2.2 ml). Topped up by hand (1.3 ml) before moving.
Site Comments: This darker coloured bear was caught in Laura’s snare and his lighter coloured brother (EVGM101, Tommy) was caught in Clayton’s snare. This bear was in the snare before we had finished baiting the site!
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer with waterproof treatment, cut a tiny bit on both sides. Programmed to blow off in 2 years, but we want it off by the summer of 2021.
Bear Comments: Bear looked to be in great shape. Nice teeth, good and fat. Didn’t do fat because we were pressed for time. These siblings have been around the mine for months and didn’t seem to have any fear of humans.
Comment: Captured him from the helicopter on 1 Sep 2020. Removed Followit collar 6641 and replaced it with Vectronic collar 42577.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Drug Comments: First dart hit front left shoulder. Bear went down well. Finished Zoletil vial 19-511 and used Zoletil vial 19-510.
Site Comments: Caught in Clayton’s snare. Laura’s snare not sprung.
Other Wound Comments: Lots of old wounds on his back and head (they had scabbed over but were still oozing a bit). His ears were beat up, especially his right one (it almost looked like it had turned inside out). He had almost no teeth and his tongue had a split in it.
Rot off comments: Laura 5 layer (2 layer and 3 layer stacked) with waterproof treatment. Programmed to blow off in 2 years.
Bear Comments: This bear is OLD! He has almost no teeth. Could not take a premolar to age because he didn’t have any. He didn’t have much fat on him (you could feel his vertebrae easily) and his skin seemed almost saggy. We thought it was a new bear who we named “Wayne” (EVGM99), but the genetics showed it was actually "Gums" (EVGM77).
Comment: Last received data from this collar on 23 Jan 2020 at what looked like a den site. Troy couldn’t find the collar when he searched in June 2020.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Drug Comments: First dart (2.2 ml) hit high on front right shoulder. Bear went down well. Started Zoletil vial 19-511.
Site Comments: Caught him in Clayton’s snare on his front right foot (snare was over his pads). Laura’s snare not sprung.
Other Wound Comments: Front left leg has been previously broken and healed in such a way that the movement was limited. Broken top left canine, but it was smoothed off (not recent).
Rot off comments: Vectronic 3 layer (2 x 2 ply, but cut one layer in half). Programmed to blow off in 117 weeks (2.25 years), but we want it off by summer 2021. Drop off ID is 13871.
Bear Comments: 58 cm collar, 7 holes from the rot-off (2nd hole from the end). Could ALMOST get this over his head, but with his busted left arm, we don’t think he could work it off.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Stu Clow
Drug Comments: First dart (2.5 ml) hit in the front shin. Didn’t go down right away, but did go down hard. Used remainder of vial 18-050 and started vial 19-236.
Site Comments: She tore up the site and turned it into a mud hole. Laura’s snare was sprung, but we caught her in Clayton’s snare.
Rot off comments: Laura 6 layer (3 x 2 layer) with waterproof treatment. Programmed to blow off in 3 years.
Bear Comments: Did not take a tooth because she had no premolars (all 4 are gone). Didn’t do fat because she was soaking wet and it was raining, but she seemed to be in really good shape and had a full gut.
Comment: Caught her again at Morrissey (NCC Meadow), but didn’t change her collar.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Drug Comments: First dart hit (2.5 ml), then topped up by hand with 1.5 ml. Vials 18-049 and part of 18-050.
Site Comments: Caught her in Clayton’s snare. Good catch. Just a bit of rubbing by the snare on her wrist. She didn’t make it to the bait or to Laura’s snare.
Other Wound Comments: Her tail is gone (see photos). The wound is not super recent, but it is not yet fully healed.
Rot off comments: Vectronic 6 layer (3 x 2 layer). Programmed to blow off in 208 weeks (almost 4 years). Blow off ID is 13869.
Bear Comments: Teeth very worn (almost no top incisors). She has no tail (see photos)! 65 cm collar in 4th hole from the rot off. Didn’t do fat (too wet), but she’s in good shape. Can only feel backbone when pushed down quite hard. Looks to have lots of fat deposited over rump. Matson’s aged the tooth at 12-14 (B) and chose 12 years old, with no aging notes. When we genotyped Elaine’s live capture sample, we saw that she had been detected in Apps’ 2003 inventory, so she was at least 16 years old when we caught her.

Surveyors: Bruce McLellan, Clay Wilson, Garth Mowat
Drug Comments: First dart (2 vials) hit on right butt cheek. Bear went down hard. Topped up twice by hand on the ground (1 vial total; 0.5 vial and 0.5 vial).
Site Comments: 2 x COY (both in good shape)
Trap Wound Comments: 5 cm cut under her left eye (she fell on a stick). Vet sewed it up with 6 large stitches (see photo).
Rot off comments: Laura 4 layer (2 x 2 layer) with waterproof treatment. Programmed to blow off in 3 years.
Bear Comments: Old fatometer = R98/XC10. Did not take a tooth. Two big huckleberry poops.

Surveyors: Clay Wilson, Garth Mowat, Bruce McLellan
Drug Comments: Dart (3 vials) hit high on right butt cheek.
Site Comments: 1 x COY
Trap Wound Comments: 3 cm gash on right rear heel pad.
Rot off comments: Laura 6 layer (3 x 2 layer) with waterproof treatment. Programmed to blow off in 3 years.
Bear Comments: Body condition = 2. Had a huckleberry poop (see photo). Didn’t do fat. Removed Followit collar 6485 (as it had stopped working) and replaced it with Followit collar 6003.

Surveyors: Pat Stent, Garth Mowat, Clay Wilson
Drug Comments: 4 vials
Site Comments: Jimmy (EVGM90) and JimmyMom (EVGF93) present.
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer with waterproof treatment. Pre-programmed to blow off in 2 years.
Bear Comments: They didn’t take a tooth. When we caught Jimmy in Sep 2018, we thought he was 2 (based on weight), but in spring 2019 JimmySis was only 46 kg (tiny!) so we didn’t think she could be 3. Matson’s aged Jimmy’s tooth at 1-2 (B) but they chose 1, so it makes most sense that Jimmy was 1 in 2018, which means JimmySis was 2 in 2019.

Surveyors: Clay Wilson, Pat Stent, Garth Mowat
Drug Comments: 2 vials
Site Comments: Jimmy (EVGM90) and JimmySis (EVGF94) were with her.
Rot off comments: Laura 4 layer (2 x 2 layer) with waterproof treatment. Pre-programmed to blow off in 4 years.
Bear Comments: Blind in left eye; body condition = 2.
Comment: The collar last sent data on 2 November 2019, and the collar was emitting the mortality signal from her den site during the cub flight on 25 May 2020. Troy retrieved this collar, and it had fallen off due to a hardware failure.

Surveyors: Garth Mowat, Pat Stent, Clay Wilson
Drug Comments: 1st dart = 3 vials Zoletil in 6cc dart. 2nd dart = 2 vials Zoletil in 4cc dart.
Site Comments: Bubbles’ COY and Monica were present.
Trap Wound Comments: Almost drowned. Used CPR to bring her back.
Rot off comments: Laura 4 layer (2 x 2 layer) with waterproof treatment. Pre-programmed to blow off in 4 years.
Bear Comments: 1 COY and Monica were with Bubbles. Nearly drowned in creek. Body condition = 2-2.5.
Comment: Collar was double beeping during the capture flight in September 2020.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Location (address): River Forest Service Rd, East Kootenay A BC V0B 1M1, Canada
Location: River Forest Service Rd, East Kootenay A BC V0B 1M1, Canada [49.463028,-115.052315]
Location comments: Cokato Landing (culvert), then moved to CO office to process (snow storm on the way). Let her wake up inside in the culvert inside, then drove her up Cokato and released her (49.41626, -115.02499), about 5.5 km from her capture location.
Drug Comments: Jab stick. First jab didn’t expel the drug. Second jab worked successfully.
Rot off comments: Laura 3 layer with waterproof treatment. Programmed to blow off in 3 years. When we thought she was 4 we were comfortable with it staying on for 3 years, but with the tooth age of 2, we want it off by summer 2020!
Bear Comments: Collar sized to 55.5 cm. Won’t go over head, but lots of room to grow. We didn’t do fat because she was very wet.
Comment: Collar sent data very infrequently in spring 2020 (last transmission June 23). Captured her from the helicopter on 5 Sep 2020. Removed Followit collar 6484 (the VHF beacon was in recovery mode) and replaced it with Vectronic collar 42580. We were able to recover all data stored on collar 6484.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Location comments: Brule bait cache culvert (the GPS location is the pit where we processed him).
Drug Comments: 1.5 vials Zoletil (1 vial in jab stick and 0.5 vial by hand).
Site Comments: This bear’s mum and sibling were free and hanging around. They had completely buried the elk we had left by the trap. We moved Jimmy and processed him in Brule Pit and then returned him to very near the culvert.
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer, nicked significantly on both sides, with waterproof treatment. Programmed to blow off in 4 years. We want it off by mid-August 2019.
Bear Comments: Collar was fitted to 55 cm. Would be great to fly in spring 2019 and collar this bear’s mum.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Drug Comments: First dart (3.2 ml) hit a bit high (in the hump), so gave him another 3.2 ml and he went down well.
Trap Wound Comments: Bled quite a bit from his two dart holes (not sure why because the removal was the same as usual). Caught high up his leg (on his stump foot), the area was rubbed, but the skin wasn’t broken.
Other Wound Comments: Missing all toes on front left foot and doesn’t have the single claw he had in the spring. Two old puncture wounds on his neck, and an old healed slash wound in his right armpit.
Rot off comments: Laura 4 layer (2 x 2 layer) with waterproof treatment. Programmed to blow off in 2 years.
Bear Comments: He had ripped out his left ear tag, so we gave him a new one (52). Took off his collar that we had lost contact with (Follow It 6276) and replaced it with Follow It 6278. We put the collar on at about 77 cm, which is tighter than his last collar (which was at 82 cm and very loose). Original weight was 253 kg, but had to subtract the weight of the log (12.6 kg) and tarp (4 kg).
Comment: Collar started sending infrequent, monthly (instead of 4x daily) locations, then quit fully on 19 Apr 2019. The VHF beacon was double beeping (broken) on a telemetry flight on 16 Jul 2019.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Drug Comments: First dart hit and bear went down well.
Rot off comments: Laura 6 layer (3 x 2 layer) with waterproof treatment. Programmed to blow off in 2 years.
Comment: The VHF was double beeping (broken) on a telemetry flight on 16 Jul 2019, and we last received data from this collar on 22 Jul 2019.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Drug Comments: 1st dart hit (2 ml XZT). Took a little while to go down, and she didn’t fully. Clayton hand injected her with an additional 1.2 ml XZT.
Site Comments: Caught in Clayton’s snare, Laura’s snare not sprung. Bear dug a big hole in her trap circle and her snare was “birdcaged” but no wire strands were broken.
Other Wound Comments: Open cut on her left (non snared) foot, but she didn’t seem to have this cut when we caught her on this foot on the 18th. Maybe she licked it raw?
Rot off comments: Laura 4 layer (2 x 2 layer) with waterproof treatment. Programmed to blow off in 4 years.
Bear Comments: Didn’t weigh her again. Took new curved length (she’s shorter) and did fat again (her number was higher, as we expected). Measured her neck again (3 cm smaller). Put collar on at 64.5 cm (had been at 65.5 cm). We don’t expect her to get much fatter and didn’t want her collar to swing in the spring.
Comment: Collar started sending intermittent fixes. Confirmed alive via VHF location and visual of her and cubs, then recaptured 23 Aug 2019.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Trish Burley
Drug Comments: First dart hit. He ripped it out, but he likely got all the drug. Went down well.
Trap Wound Comments: Broke a couple of claws on his front left foot. Broke a piece off his bottom right canine.
Rot off comments: Laura 3 layer with waterproof treatment (no photo). Programmed to blow off in 2 years. We would like the collar to come off in summer 2020 (if we can blow it off remotely).
Comment: Collar likely fell off/failed in his den in winter 2018/19. The collar was never recovered, but we know he was alive when his collar failed because he was later caught and dispatched by COS on 13 May 2020 in Jaffray.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Ryan Gordon, Jeff Piwek
Location comments: 7611 Baynes Lake Road, Jaffray (capture location). COs took the bear (in trailer) about 5 km down the road to a field by the river. We processed it and released it there. The GPS location is the release site.
Drug Comments: Jab sticked with 1.3 ml XZT
Other Wound Comments: Broke a couple of claws on front right foot (likely while in culvert trap).
Rot off comments: Laura 3 layer with waterproof treatment. Programmed to blow off in 2 years. We want it off in spring if 2020.
Bear Comments: Couldn’t do fat because the fatometer battery was dead.
Comment: Collar started to reboot and send many locations right before he denned. A collared, young bear caught on trail cam in Jaffray in spring, he was the only bear we had that went right into that town, likely him, collar just died.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Ryan Gordon, Jeff Piwek
Drug Comments: Jab sticked it, went down fast.
Site Comments: This bear’s mum was around. We saw her on the camera, but never when we were there.
Bear Comments: We thought this was a COY. Probably about 60 lbs. Didn’t even flip it over to get sex (so we asked WGI to determine sex genetically). Popped two ear tags in, quickly reversed the drug, and got out of there. WGI told us it was a female. This bear was dispatched by COS in September 2019 and a tooth was collected. Matson’s lab aged the tooth definitively at 2 years, so she must have been a yearling when we caught her in Sep 2018.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Jeff Piwek
Drug Comments: 1st dart (3.2 ml) hit. Bear went down hard in about two minutes. Topped up with 1 ml XZT because he was very big and we initially under drugged him.
Site Comments: Caught in Clayton’s snare. Laura’s snare not sprung.
Trap Wound Comments: We had to really dig the dart out, so he had a bit of an open wound that we put antiseptic on.
Other Wound Comments: Old scar across his nose. Canines were mostly broken (seemed like this was likely pre-capture).
Rot off comments: Laura 6 layer (3 x 2 layer) with waterproof treatment. Collar programmed to blow off in 2 years. Took photos before we cut the collar under the rot off (but we definitely cut it).
Bear Comments: He was wet and it was raining so we didn’t do fat. He was still touching the ground a little bit when we weighed him, so he might be more like 280 kg.
Comment: We last received data from this collar on 1 Jul 2019, and the VHF was double beeping (broken) on a telemetry flight on 16 Jul 2019. This collar was recovered by Dennis Raghenas in May 2020. It had fallen off due to a hardware issue, but the battery had died by 21 Jul 2019.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Trish Burley
Drug Comments: 1st dart was 1.7 ml XZT, topped up with 1 ml XZT, then 0.8 ml twice. It was cold and rainy so we worked quickly and didn’t take all measurements.
Site Comments: Caught in Clayton’s snare. She really tore up the trap circle. Laura’s snare was sprung.
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer with waterproof treatment. Collar programmed to blow off in 3 years, but we want it off by summer 2020.
Bear Comments: She was wet so we didn’t do fat.
Comment: We last received data from her collar on 13 Nov 2019 (and the location was in the Elk River). We didn’t hear the VHF beacon during the spring 2020 cub flight. Monica was hit and killed on Hwy 3 on 31 Oct 2020. She was not wearing her collar at the time of her death.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Trish Burley
Drug Comments: 0.5 vial Zoletil in the jab stick (no action, maybe didn’t go in), repeated with another 0.5 vial and bear went down instantly.
Site Comments: Caught in Laura’s snare. This COY’s mum (Amy, EVGF83) caught in Clayton’s snare, and a second COY loose.
Trap Wound Comments: Broke upper right incisor (likely while in snare).
Bear Comments: COY of Amy (EVGF83).

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Trish Burley
Drug Comments: 1st dart hit front shoulder, bear went down well. When we reversed her, she was head and shoulders up in about 5 minutes!
Site Comments: Amy caught in Clayton’s snare, 1 COY (EVGF84) caught in Laura’s snare, a second COY loose.
Rot off comments: Laura 4 layer (2 x 2 layer) with waterproof treatment. Programmed to blow off in 4 years.
Bear Comments: Not clear if she was lactating, but she had two COYs with her (EVGF84 and one other).

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Cali Lewis
Drug Comments: 1.5 vials Telazol in first dart (hit in ribs, didn’t go down), 0.75 vial Telazol in second dart (good shot, still not fully out), third dart had some XZT.
Site Comments: Cold, foggy and wet grass today. Should clear later. Caught in Laura’s snare, Clayton’s snare not sprung.
Other Wound Comments: Some old scarring on her face. A few new small cuts on her snout.
Rot off comments: Laura 4 layer (2 x 2 layer) with waterproof treatment. Programmed to blow off in 4 years.
Bear Comments: Caught last night around 19:30, but it was too dark to process. Tooth broke when it was taken out, but will still send it to be aged (as it was the only premolars she had).

Surveyors: Garth Mowat, Bruce McLellan, Clay Wilson
Location comments: Same cut block as Brittney and Casey. Bears eating V. scoparium.
Drug Comments: 3.5 vials Zoletil. She went down very quickly and very hard.
Site Comments: Sue’s COY; plus Casey (EVGF68) and Brittney (EVGF57).
Trap Wound Comments: The dart struck her pelvis bone and had to be removed with a lot of force.
Rot off comments: Laura 3 layer (with waterproof treatment). Programmed to blow off in three years.
Bear Comments: Very skinny. Body condition = 1. She was heavily shedding all over her back and sides (see photo). Accompanied by one very small cub (she had 2 x COY in May). Sue’s old collar (Vectronic 15108) was way too loose but no rubbing or infection.

Surveyors: Garth Mowat, Bruce McLellan, Clay Wilson
Location comments: Same cut block as Casey and Sue. Bears eating V. scoparium.
Drug Comments: 3.5 vials Zoletil in dart, then topped up by hand with 1 vial Zoletil.
Site Comments: Casey (EVGF68) and Sue (EVGF45) with her COY.
Rot off comments: Laura 3 layer (with waterproof treatment). We want it off in about 4 years.
Bear Comments: Skull = 34 cm. Brittney was unaccompanied (no offspring). Her old collar (6006) was too loose, and she had a bit of rubbing on her neck. She was hot (max temp = 40.9, so soaked her with water).

Surveyors: Garth Mowat, Bruce McLellan, Clay Wilson
Drug Comments: 3.5 vials Zoletil
Trap Wound Comments: Dart hit belly. It did not look like it went in very deeply, so it may not have perforated her abdomen lining.
Other Wound Comments: Her neck was badly rubbed and her skin was infected and smelled rotten. The collar was too loose.
Rot off comments: Laura 3 layer (with waterproof treatment). Programmed to blow off in two years.
Bear Comments: Skull length = 32.7 cm. Unaccompanied (no offspring). No samples collected.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb
Site Comments: One yearling spotted
Rot off comments: Laura 3 layer
Comment: VHF doesn’t work

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Garth Mowat
Drug Comments: It was very cold (0 degrees) so we used straight Telazol (2 vials) with about 1 ml of XZT in the dart, then right away topped up with 1 vial Telazol with a bit of XZT. Reversed him with 0.7 ml APZ when we left.
Trap Wound Comments: A small amount of swelling on his front right foot from the snare.
Other Wound Comments: Right eye looks almost sealed shut and doesn’t seem to really be used, and there is a small new cut above that eye. Puncture wound (old) on underside of throat.
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer attached to the outside of the collar at the point where this 65 cm collar was extended.
Bear Comments: He was fat!
Comment: Gary was detected between 5-Jun-2018 and 12-Jul-2018 at a rub tree in Grave Creek

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Garth Mowat, Trish Burley
Drug Comments: First dart hit (3.2 ml XZT), bear went down well. Topped up with 2cc Telazol at 9:30. Topped up several times with XZT (about 7 ml total) then a bit of Telazol at the end. Reversed with APZ when we left, then again two hours later. Bear was down for a long time (walked away at 2am).
Site Comments: From drone flight CL could see his foot was bleeding badly.
Trap Wound Comments: He chewed 3 toes off his snared left foot. We wrapped it with cloth to stop bleeding. Vet from Tanglefoot (Tim) came with 2 techs (Amanda & ?) and they cleaned the wound, sutured it up, gave him a big dose of antibiotic and an anti-inflammatory.
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer attached on the outside of the collar at the point where this 65 cm collar was extended. Pre-programmed to blow off in 3 years.
Bear Comments: Bear was also called Tim (in the genetic data). Chewed off 3 toes on left foot. The two outer toes remain. Didn’t take many measurements as we didn’t want to disturb him any more than necessary.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Garth Mowat, Laura Smit, Matt Corbett
Location comments: Mallard Ranch, 687 Wardner Road, near Fort Steele
Drug Comments: Jab stick with 1.5 vials, but didn’t go down fully, so topped up by hand with 1 full vial. Gave another 0.5 vial near end of processing as he was coming around.
Other Wound Comments: Burn (or an area rubbed and worn bare) on right rump.
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer attached at the point where this small collar (formally worn by Sid) was extended (as we see on the new Vectronics collars).
Bear Comments: Matt had killed livestock (beef calf) on the property.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Garth Mowat, Ryan Gordon
Drug Comments: Hit with 3.2 mL dart and topped up with 1.5 mL dart (before we started processing him).
Trap Wound Comments: Superficial snare wound on top of wrist (caught on his left foot, which only has 1 toe).
Rot off comments: Laura 3 layer, attached at the point where this 65 cm collar was extended (as we see on the new Vectronics collars). Pre-programmed to blow off in 3 years.
Bear Comments: Missing 4 toes on front left foot (as last year). Old collar a bit loose, fur rubbed off under chin, but no open wound under chin. Sized the new FollowIt collar a bit smaller than the old Vectronic collar to minimize swinging.
Comment: This collar lost satellite connection 28 June 2018 (VHF still worked though). We caught Olson in a snare off Hosmer Main on 28 Sep 2018. Took off Followit collar 6276 and replaced with Followit collar 6278.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Sam Medcalf, Chad Bowen
Trap Wound Comments: Right pad cut from snare
Rot off comments: Laura 3 layer, but really a Laura 2 layer + 1/2 of another Laura 2 layer... making 3 layers.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb
Other Wound Comments: Missing portion of upper jaw. Almost no teeth. Fluid between skin and muscle on head, neck and hump.
Rot off comments: Laura 3 layer
Bear Comments: Don't really trust fat measure as he had lots of water and swelling in neck and shoulders which will add water to measure but isn't fat. Was generally pretty skinny.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Ryan Gordon
Drug Comments: 2 vials
Rot off comments: Changed to Laura 3 layer
Bear Comments: Bear looks healthy. Didn't intend to capture again. But changed to 3 layer rot off and added grease into collar port. Bear very docile in snare.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Ryan Gordon
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Ryan Gordon, Trish Burley

Location: 6701–6849 Bryant Rd, East Kootenay A BC, Canada [49.568540,-115.005613]

Other Wound Comments: Left humerus broken. Left toes cut off, two middle toes still on with claws long.

Bear Comments: Healthy bear even with broken front leg. Weight estimate is approx. feel confident that bear is between 340-430 pounds.

Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer, not cut.
Bear Comments: Matson’s lab says the tooth age could possibly be 4, but no older.
Comment: Her collar rotted off in her den and Troy dug it out on 7 Sep 2019.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Frank Deboon, Trish Burley
Drug Comments: First dart didn't seem to do anything, so hit it with anther full 2mL XZT.
Site Comments: Another bear (Melissa, EVGF73) caught in another snare at the site.
Other Wound Comments: Pussy hole on back from when she was darted in town (see photos).
End Reason: Killed by COS, but no collar

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Trish Burley, Ryan Gordon
Site Comments: The man who reported the capture said there had been a sow running around (likely Kathy), but no sign when we arrived.
Other Wound Comments: Cut on front right foot (we caught him on the front left), so we put antiseptic on it.
Bear Comments: This is Kathy's cub. We think he is a yearling.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Ryan Gordon, Frank Deboon
Other Wound Comments: She had a big cut on her back right leg. She also had a little puncture wound on the back of her neck. We put Chlorohexidine on both wounds.
Rot off comments: Laura single-double, not cut.
Bear Comments: 58 cm collar.
Comment: VHF doesn’t appear to work.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Darren Reghenas, Ryan Gordon
Drug Comments: 2 vials Telazol, then topped up with with 2 more vials of Telazol.
Site Comments: Another bear (Basil) caught in a snare at the site.
Other Wound Comments: His eyes looked a bit puffy and red.
Rot off comments: Laura single-double
Bear Comments: Very calm in the snare. His neck and chest were the same size as last year. He got one of the resized 60cm collar. No time to do body fat.
Comment: Kenny was detected between 25-Sep-2018 and 27-Oct-2018 at the mink farm fence

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Darren Reghenas, Ryan Gordon
Drug Comments: 1.5 vials of Telazol, then topped up with 2mL Telazol.
Site Comments: Another bear (Kenny) also caught in a snare at the site.
Rot off comments: Laura tri-pop, first layer nicked a little bit on both sides
Bear Comments: 60cm collar on 4th smallest hole.
Comment: Basil was detected between 25-Sep-2018 and 27-Oct-2018 at the mink farm fence

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Trish Burley
Drug Comments: Hit with 2.5 (in the hump - no drug went in), then 3.2 (but she ripped it out), likely the 3.2 went in.
Site Comments: Hadn't destroyed the site much at all.
Trap Wound Comments: Everything looks good.
Rot off comments: Laura 3 layer
Bear Comments: 58 cm collar on 4th smallest hole.
Comment: VHF doesn’t work.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Frank Deboon
Location comments: Eating apples in yard on Alpine Way.
Site Comments: Darted in the front yard (in he dark), ran across he street and down the bank.
Bear Comments: Bear darted and put in culvert on night of Sept. 14. Driven up Hosmer Main on afternoon of Sept. 15, processed, and shot by CO Burley.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Bill Hanlon, Frank Deboon
Drug Comments: Dart was pulled out by bear fast
Rot off comments: Laura 3 layer
Bear Comments: No evidence of having cubs before.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Trish Burley, Frank Deboon
Rot off comments: Laura single-double; with the double nicked a bit on both sides
Bear Comments: Clayton broke both premolars when he was trying to extract them. Matson’s lab says the tooth age could be as old as 10.
Comment: VHF doesn’t work. Mike was detected between 28-Sep-2018 and 27-Oct-2018 at a rub tree on the Stairway to Heaven trail.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Frank Deboon

Rot off comments: Laura 3 layer

Comment: VHF doesn’t work.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Frank Deboon
Site Comments: Bear's mom present (Kathy, EVGF66)
Bear Comments: This is Kathy's cub. We think he is a yearling.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Ryan Gordon
Drug Comments: 2.2 mL of 300 mg/mL, then again with 2.2mL of 300 mg/mL
Trap Wound Comments: Snared foot looks good, not swollen.
Other Wound Comments: Breathing heavily, hot, so got water on her right away. She ripped out the second dart and chewed it up.
Rot off comments: Laura 3 layer
Bear Comments: Needed to re-collar because the Iridium function on the original collar failed. Remember to subtract tarp weight from her weight. Put the collar one half hole smaller than last time (on hole 4.5 smallest). Her fur under the collar was already matted and worn away. We were concerned about swinging, so we tightened it up a bit. Forgot that we hadn’t taken a tooth to age when we caught her in May, so we failed to take a tooth this time.
Comment: VHF doesn’t appear to work. Caught at rub tree after Oct 1, 2017, Sparwood Powerline, then detected between 9-Sep-2018 and 28-Oct-2018 at a rub tree on the Sparwood powerline.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Joe Caravetta, Ryan Gordon
Drug Comments: 3.2 mL of 300 mg/mL XZT.
Trap Wound Comments: Snared on front left foot. All looked good.
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer
Bear Comments: Large (75cm) collar. Punched new holes between the third and fourth largest holes. Could fit two sets of fingers (plus a little bit) under the collar.  Originally called this bear "Jimmy, EVGM65" until we found out by DNA that it was Darren.
Comment: Collar retrieved by member of public in early 2018. It appeared to have fallen off, but it was hanging in a tree. Mildly suspicious, but we had many of these same rot-offs fail in similar fashion so it seems okay.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit, Trish Burley
Site Comments: 2 COYs (weight guess is 70-80 lbs each, which we think is too small for yearlings?)
Trap Wound Comments: Snared foot looks good, skin not broken
Other Wound Comments: Growth on back of left leg (see photo)
Rot off comments: Laura 3 layer
Bear Comments: Small (65cm) collar on second smallest hole. Two sets of fingers can fit under the collar. Swollen teats, no milk obvious. She was hot so we poured river water on her a couple times and left her to recover in the shade. Didn't do BIA because she was wet on the tarp.
Comment: Recaptured alive on 29 May 2018, but she wasn’t wearing this collar. Recollared with Followit collar 6274.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Location comments: Around 112.5 km on Elk FSR. He was walking up the road and CL free ranged him.
Drug Comments: First dart hit. Bear wandered a bit but soon dropped right at the road.
Other Wound Comments: Right ear has ear tag transmitter, looks infected. Documented with photos. Left ear has tag orange 163. Took it out. Replaced with 61. Gave anesthetic in right ear.
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer. Nicked both layers about 1cm on both sides. Had to punch one extra set of holes on a small collar.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Laura Smit
Location comments: Base of slide up ATV trail off Nordstrom.
Drug Comments: 1st dart hit, left shoulder.
Trap Wound Comments: Broke skin, foot a bit swollen, but not too bad.
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer
Bear Comments: Collar was too big on tightest preset holes. Punched new holes to make it 57 cm.  Tail is 11 cm.
Comment: Darted her from the heli, took off collar 6057, and gave her collar 6273.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb, Abbey Wilson, Trish Burley, Ryan Gordon
Drug Comments: Bear went down well.
Other Wound Comments: Scar on right side of muzzle
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer
Bear Comments: Tail length: 14cm 65 cm collar 2nd tightest hole, rained before we processed bear and ground moisture seemed to mess up fatometer. Reading was about 96-89
Comment: Hit by a train and collar torn into two pieces.

Surveyors: Clayton Lamb
Other Wound Comments: Bottom right canine broken.
Rot off comments: Laura 2 layer
Bear Comments: Appears to have previously worn a collar. Looks like it once had left ear tag. Thought it was Cameo, but it was a male. Is this maybe "Red" from Alberta Parks?

Site Comments: Chewed through tree beside him.

Bear Comments: Collar is in middle hole of 75 collar (have extra 8cm of holes).
Comment: Feng – detected between 28-Sep-2018 and 25-Oct-2018 at a rub tree in Dry Creek.

Comment: Darted her from the heli, took off collar 6006, and gave her collar 6260.

Drug Comments: Darted at 9:14am. First dart missed (bad dart gun). Second dart missed (Frank's gun). Third dart got her.
Site Comments: Dug a big hole all around snare site. Chewed up surrounding Cottonwoods.
Rot off comments: 4 layer Vectronic factory-made and 1 layer of fire hose.
Bear Comments: Did not have tooth extractor. Bear was clearly older (based on size and tooth wear). Earliest detection in SRGBP is 2012.
Comment: This collar lost satellite connection in early summer 2017 (VHF still worked though). We recaptured Laura on 27 August 2017. Removed collar 6054 and collared with Followit 6059.

Location (address): 663 Wardner-Fort Steele Rd, East Kootenay C BC, Canada
Location: 663 Wardner-Fort Steele Rd, East Kootenay C BC, Canada [49.585177,-115.576828]
Location comments: Captured near Norbury Lake (where she and her offspring had been getting in trouble for stealing honey), then moved to Van Creek.
Drug Comments: 1 vial of Telazol (shot with pneudart gun), then topped up by hand once.
Site Comments: She was accompanied by two male offspring, who were both immobilized and relocated with her - 1st male (L yellow ear tag #4301), 2nd male (L yellow ear tag #4307).
Bear Comments: On 26 September 2015, Honey and her cubs were relocated to the Bull River Valley at the first main switchback heading back down to Tanglefoot River from Van Creek. No tooth was taken during this capture event, but the tooth age from the 2017 CI record was 9, so Honey was 7 in 2015.
Comment: Dead

Surveyors: Pat Stent, Frank Deboon, Joe Caravetta, Joe Garay, Jared Connatty, Ray Gilewicz
Location comments: Sheena had been killing chickens at Hutchinson's farm (6829 Bryant Road, Hosmer). See HWCR #15-10132 for more details.
Drug Comments: 3 attempts with jab stick, each with 1 vial of Telazol. First two jab stick attempts didn't go into bear, but third attempt (with 1 vial of Telazol) was successful.
Site Comments: She was with her 2 yearling cubs, who were both snared - 1 male (R yellow ear tag #4487), 1 female (R yellow ear tag #4488).
Bear Comments: Weight was estimated. CI record says tooth wasn’t extracted, but age was estimated at 9 years. On 31 Aug 2015, all three bears were hard released with rubber bullets and cracker shells on the Hutchinsons' property.
